humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that there are metastases in 10 out of 24 lymph nodes (10/24) in the right axillary contents. This corresponds to the N3 stage as per the AJCC staging system.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer in the lymph nodes. In this pathology report, the 'A. AXILLARY CONTENTS' section indicates that there are 24 lymph nodes examined, and metastatic carcinoma is found in 10 of them. This information supports the prediction of N3 stage. The largest metastasis is 3.5 cm. Therefore, the N stage from this report is N3, ignoring any substaging information.
